tpbyrc wrote:

> I am running JUnitEE It works fine on subsets of my test suite but
> when I run the whole suite (about 700 tests) I get an out of memory
> exception while xalan is formtting the reports.
> 
> I don't want to solve this just by increasing the process space if
> that's only going to stave off the problem until my test suite grows.
> 
> Is this a Xalan version issue (1.2.2) that would be solved by an
> upgrade? Or is there something I can do to make XALAN handle memory
> more robustly?

I think an upgrade of Xalan fixes the problem. I have a vague 
recollection of going through this myself.
